transportAdvice: Ayutthaya's historical sites are spread across a fairly large area, making walking practical only within clusters of ruins; renting a bicycle or tuk-tuk is the most common way to get around. Taxis and songthaews (shared pickup trucks) are generally available, and the town is easily reached from Bangkok by train or minibus.

weather.description: Cool and dry with clear skies, making it the most comfortable month for exploring outdoor ruins.
Warm and mostly sunny with very little rain, still pleasant for sightseeing.
Temperatures begin to climb noticeably; hot afternoons but dry conditions persist.
One of the hottest months of the year with occasional early-season showers beginning toward month's end.
The wet season begins with frequent afternoon thunderstorms and rising humidity.
Regular heavy rain, often in the afternoons; outdoor temple visits are best done in the morning.
Continued monsoon rains with overcast skies and occasional flooding in low-lying areas.
One of the wettest months; flooding around the island can affect access to some sites.
Peak flood risk month as rivers swell; some ruins may be partially submerged or inaccessible.
Rain begins to ease but flooding can linger; conditions gradually improve toward month's end.
The dry season returns with cooler evenings and decreasing rainfall, making it a good time to visit.
